name: Glacier National Park Centennial Poster - Goat's Eye View
description: This award-winning piece by Pete Thomas was selected as official artwork for the Glacier National Park Centennial. The vibrant 18" x 24" poster displays an iconic scene of 'A Goat's Eye View from Mt. Siyeh' overlooking the magnificent skyline of the Garden Wall and the classic, steep topography of the park. Designed in the spirit of vintage travel art and posters of the WPA era, this is a true collectible and a perfect gift. The poster ships in a protective tube and a portion of sales goes to support various non-profit groups connected to Glacier National Park.

name: Glacier National Park Poster - Birdwoman Falls
description: This 18" x 24" poster captures the quintessential Glacier National Park scene of Birdwoman Falls. Anyone who has travelled the famed Going-to-the-Sun Road has marveled at this spectacular site. Follow a lone grizzly bear's movement across the foreground of this iconic piece. Conveniently sized to fit a standard frame, and shipped in a protective tube, bring Glacier National Park into your home, office or share as a gift.

name: Glacier National Park Limited Edition Serigraph - Birdwoman Falls
description:
This limited edition (screen printed) serigraph by Pete Thomas brilliantly captures the quintessential Birdwoman Fall scene in Glacier National Park. Exuding the iconic flavor of the old WPA travel art of our National Parks and vintage railroad posters, this piece is a must-have for art collectors. The print is signed and numbered by the artist, also containing a certificate of authenticity; shipped in a protective tube. 

16" x 20" 10-color Serigraph, Limited Edition of 200

name: Whitefish Centennial - Ski Poster
description:
Introduced to celebrate the Centennial for Whitefish, Montana, this ski poster is one of four in a series of art capturing themes of historical significance for the Northwestern town. Captioned "Big Mountain's 'Father of Skiing,' Lloyd 'Mully' Muldown, circa 1947," the piece brings to life one of the original ski pioneers of what is now Whitefish Mountain Resort.

A portion of the sale of this series is contributed to Stumptown Historical Society.

16" x 24"

name: Whitefish Centennial - Train Poster
description:
Introduced to celebrate the Centennial for Whitefish, Montana, this train poster is one of four in a series of art capturing themes of historical significance for the Northwestern town. Captioned "Great Northern's mighty Class S-2 Number 2586 westbound from Whitefish Depot, circa 1939," the piece captures the enormous engine in its beautiful Glacier National Park color scheme, steam pumping, with The Great Northern Peak in the background. A true tribute to the railroad's history. 

A portion of the sale of this series is contributed to Stumptown Historical Society.

16" x 24"

name: Whitefish Centennial - Golf Poster
description:
Introduced to celebrate the Centennial for Whitefish, Montana, this golf poster is one of four in a series of art capturing themes of historical significance for the Northwestern town. Captioned "Fairways and airplanes--a good combo, Whitefish Lake Golf Club, circa 1942," the piece not only illustrates the brilliant autumn fun, but cleverly provides commentary on its roots as a WPA-funded airstrip.

A portion of the sale of this series is contributed to Stumptown Historical Society.

16" x 24"

name: Whitefish Centennial - Downtown Poster
description:
Introduced to celebrate the Centennial for Whitefish, Montana, this poster of a beautiful downtown scene is one of four in a series of art capturing themes of historical significance for the Northwestern town. The snapshot caption reads, "Enjoying a summertime stroll downtown Whitefish, Central Avenue, circa 1960." 

A portion of the sale of this series is contributed to Stumptown Historical Society.

16" x 24"
